info.name: Case Study (Upcoming Release 0.7)
info.description:
A collection of API calls against various services of the Knowledge Agents Pilot.

Also contains a special integration test subfolder.

item.name: Dataspace
OEM (Data Providing Agent)
Provisioning Agent (Intern)

body.raw:
PREFIX cx: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT ?reason ?code ?description ?version ?partend ?partcat ?partclass WHERE {
  # Select Business Partner
  ?Oem cx:BPNL "BPNL00000003COJN".

  # Search for Trouble Codes of the Business Partner
  # related to a cause in the "Kabelbaum"
  ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC.
  ?Dtc cx:provisionedBy ?Oem.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:PossibleCauses ?reason.
  FILTER contains(?reason,"Kabelbaum").
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Code ?code.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Description ?description.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Version ?version.

  # Navigate to the affected parts
  # and show only parts with a classification "Powertrain"
  ?Dtc cx-diag:affects ?Part.
  ?Part cx-diag:Category ?partcat.
  ?Part cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partend.
  ?Part cx-diag:Classification ?partclass.
  FILTER contains(?partclass,'Powertrain').

} LIMIT 40

SELECT  * WHERE   { 
    VALUES ( ?registrationDate ?loadCollective ?partProg ?mileage ?binding497849171 ) {       
        ( "{ \"Value\": 20171206,  \"Unit\": \"yyyymmdd\" }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "{ \"Temp_Oil-class\": [1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 12, 13, 17, 18, 20, 22, 23, 25, 28, 29, 31, 32, 33, 34, 36, 37, 38, 41, 42, 44, 45, 47, 48, 49, 50, 51],  \"Counts\": [7.234E+01, 2.345E+02, 6.654E+02, 5.983E+01, 4.321E+02, 3.876E+02, 5.567E+01, 3.4456E+02, 4.556645E+02, 5.678E+01, 4.321E+02, 6.098E+02, 7.432E+02, 8.873E+02, 4.738E+01, 6.927E+01, 1.234E+02, 2.345E+02, 3.654E+02, 2.983E+01, 4.321E+01, 3.876E+02, 5.567E+02, 3.4456E+02, 4.556645E+02, 5.678E+01, 4.321E+01, 6.098E+01, 3.432E+02, 1.873E+02, 4.738E+02, 6.927E+02] }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "GearOil" "{ \"Value\": 82563, \"Unit\": \"km\" }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "0" )     
        ( "{ \"Value\": 2030624,  \"Unit\": \"yyyymmdd\" }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "{ \"Temp_Oil-class\": [1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 12, 13, 17, 18, 20, 22, 23, 25, 28, 29, 31, 32, 33, 34, 36, 37, 38, 41, 42, 44, 45, 47, 48, 49, 50, 51],  \"Counts\": [7.234E+01, 2.345E+02, 6.654E+02, 5.983E+01, 4.321E+02, 3.876E+02, 5.567E+01, 3.4456E+02, 4.556645E+02, 5.678E+01, 4.321E+02, 6.098E+02, 7.432E+02, 8.873E+02, 4.738E+01, 6.927E+01, 1.234E+02, 2.345E+02, 3.654E+02, 2.983E+01, 4.321E+01, 3.876E+02, 5.567E+02, 3.4456E+02, 4.556645E+02, 5.678E+01, 4.321E+01, 6.098E+01, 3.432E+02, 1.873E+02, 4.738E+02, 6.927E+02] }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "GearOil" "{ \"Value\": 71333, \"Unit\": \"km\" }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> "1" )    
        }     
        
        ?invocation  a  <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#LifetimePrognosis> ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveBody>  ?loadCollective ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveComponent>  ?partProg ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveMileage>  ?mileage ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveRegistrationDate>  ?registrationDate ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveFile>  "{  \"Type\": \"ZF_load_collective\", \"Version\": \"1.7\"  }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#loadCollectiveHeader>  "{  \"CountingMethod\": \"ZF_TimeAtLevel\",    \"CountingUnit\": \"s\",    \"Channels\": [      {        \"Name\": \"Temp_Oil\",        \"Type\": \"Load\",        \"Unit\": \"degC\",        \"LowerLimit\": -40,        \"UpperLimit\": 220,        \"NumberOfBins\": 52      }  ]  }"^^<https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema#Object> ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#remainingDistance>  ?distance ;               
                     <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#remainingTime>  ?time   
}

item.name: Consumer (Federating Agent)
EDC (intern)

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the X-Api-Key header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
{
    "asset": {
        "properties": {
            "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:Lifetime",
            "asset:prop:contract": "<urn:cx:Skill:consumer>",
            "asset:prop:name": "Remaining Useful Lifetime Skill for Vehicles",
            "asset:prop:description": "A sample skill asset/offering implemented via SparQL.",
            "asset:prop:version": "0.6.4-SNAPSHOT",
            "asset:prop:contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
            "cx:protocol": "<urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SPARQL>",
            "rdf:type": "<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/cx_ontology.ttl#SkillAsset>",
            "rdfs:isDefinedBy": "<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>,<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/part_ontology.ttl>,<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/prognosis_ontology.ttl>",
            "cx:isFederated": true,
            "cx:shape": "PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT  ?van ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time ?vin ?troubleCode WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5"
        }
    },
    "dataAddress": {
        "properties": {
            "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:Lifetime",
            "type": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SKILL#SPARQL",
            "query": "PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT  ?van ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time ?vin ?troubleCode WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5",
            "proxyPath": "false",
            "proxyMethod": "false",
            "proxyQueryParams": "true",
            "proxyBody": "false"
        }
    }
}

request.description: Calls the datamanagement API in order to create a skill contract.
Calls the datamanagement API in order to create a skill policy.
Calls the datamanagement API in order to create a skill contract.
Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Store a Parameterized Query on Remote Graphs. Not the usage of the @ symbol to introduce a typed embedding of textual URL parameters.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT  ?van ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time ?vin ?troubleCode WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5

request.description: Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Store a Parameterized Query on Remote Graphs. Not the usage of the @ symbol to introduce a typed embedding of textual URL parameters.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#              Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Search Skill                       #
#                     Implements Trouble-Code Search based on VINs                           #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of Version and Description)             #
##############################################################################################

SELECT ?problemArea ?vin ?codeNumber ?description ?version WHERE {

    ####
    # Three parameters to the custom search
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?problemArea ?minVersion) {("@vin"^^xsd:string "@problemArea"^^xsd:string "@minVersion"^^xsd:long)}

    ####
    # Lookup the responsible OEM(s)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.
    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # Delegate to the revelant connector(s) and asset(s)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector {
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

            ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC;
                 cx-diag:Code ?codeNumber;
                 cx-diag:Description ?description;
                 cx-diag:Version ?version.

            FILTER ( CONTAINS(?description, ?problemArea) && ?version >= ?minVersion)
       
        } # Graph Asset
    } # Remote Connector
} # Search

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT ?vin ?van ?troubleCode ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("WBAAL31029PZ00001"^^xsd:string "P0745"^^xsd:string) }.

    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/prognosis_ontology.ttl>"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5

request.description: Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Perform Some Dynamic Query on Remote Graphs.
Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Perform Some Dynamic Query on Remote Graphs.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

SELECT ?vin ?van ?troubleCode ?oemConnector ?diagnoseAsset WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    SERVICE ?oemConnector {
        VALUES(?van) { str(?vin) }.
    }

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
}

request.description: Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Perform Some Dynamic Query on Remote Graphs.
Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill.

Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill using Parameters. Note the tuple syntax for URL parameters using the "(" symbol as the starting character of parameter names to introduce nesting and the ")" symbol as the ending character in parameter values to close a nested layer.

Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill using Parameters. Note the tuple syntax for URL parameters using the "(" symbol as the starting character of parameter names to introduce nesting and the ")" symbol as the ending character in parameter values to close a nested layer.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#              Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Search Skill                       #
#                     Implements Trouble-Code Search based on VINs                           #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of Version and Description)             #
##############################################################################################

SELECT ?vin ?codeNumber ?description ?version WHERE {

    ####
    # Three parameters to the custom search
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?problemArea ?minVersion) {("WBAAL31029PZ00001"^^xsd:string "Getriebe"^^xsd:string "1"^^xsd:long)}

    ####
    # Lookup the responsible OEM(s)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.
    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # Delegate to the revelant connector(s) and asset(s)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector {
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

            ####
            # the actual subselect carrying the FILTERs
            ####

            ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC;
                 cx-diag:Code ?codeNumber;
                 cx-diag:Description ?description;
                 cx-diag:Version ?version.

            FILTER ( CONTAINS(?description, ?problemArea) && ?version >= ?minVersion)
       
        } # Graph Asset
    } # Remote Connector
} # Search

exec: pm.test("Creation/Existance was successful (if not blocked by agreement)", function () {

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the X-Api-Key header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
{
  "asset": {
    "properties": {
      "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:LifetimeGearbox",
      "asset:prop:name": "Remaining Useful Lifetime Skill for Vehicles",
      "asset:prop:description": "A sample skill asset/offering implemented via SparQL.",
      "asset:prop:version": "0.5.5-SNAPSHOT",
      "asset:prop:contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
      "cx:protocol": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SPARQL",
      "rdf:type":"https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/common_ontology.ttl#SkillAsset",
      "rdfs:isDefinedBy": "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl",
      "cx:isFederated": true
    }
  },
  "dataAddress": {
    "properties": {
      "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:LifetimeGearbox",
      "type": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SKILL#SPARQL",
      "query": "PREFIX cx: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT ?reason ?code ?description ?version ?partend ?partcat ?partclass WHERE {
  # Select Business Partner
  ?Oem cx:BPNL "BPNL00000003COJN".

  # Search for Trouble Codes of the Business Partner
  # related to a cause in the "Kabelbaum"
  ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC.
  ?Dtc cx:provisionedBy ?Oem.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:PossibleCauses ?reason.
  FILTER contains(?reason,"Kabelbaum").
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Code ?code.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Description ?description.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Version ?version.

  # Navigate to the affected parts
  # and show only parts with a classification "Powertrain"
  ?Dtc cx-diag:affects ?Part.
  ?Part cx-diag:Category ?partcat.
  ?Part cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partend.
  ?Part cx-diag:Classification ?partclass.
  FILTER contains(?partclass,'Powertrain').

}
",
      "proxyPath": "false",
      "proxyMethod": "false",
      "proxyQueryParams": "true",
      "proxyBody": "false"
    }
  }
}

request.description: Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Perform Some Dynamic Query on a Local Graph (here: the federated data catalogue).
Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Store a Parameterized Query on Remote Graphs. Not the usage of the @ symbol to introduce a typed embedding of textual URL parameters.

exec: pm.test("Successful Execution of Vehicle Health Skill", function () {

body.raw:
{
    "head": { "vars": [ "van", "aggregate", "healthType" ]},
    "results": { "bindings": [
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "FNLQNRVCOFLHAQ"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } },
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "ZHWQQLLJLESMQN"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } },
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "QKAGMFRSPXRRFT"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } },
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "UICHZFTKOVJNGV"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } },
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "HNFQTWPGDVJWNG"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } },
            {   "van": { "type": "literal", "value": "OJPVGLWEEYALBC"},
                "aggregate": { "type": "literal", "value": "Differential Gear"},
                "healthType": { "type": "literal", "value": "Clutch" } }

        ]
    }
}

request.description: Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill using Parameters. Note the tuple syntax for URL parameters using the "(" symbol as the starting character of parameter names to introduce nesting and the ")" symbol as the ending character in parameter values to close a nested layer.
